alert.note: Alert for Santa Ana Mountains and Foothills (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 19 at 1:01PM PST until December 23 at 10:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM PST THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following areas, Orange County Coastal Areas, Orange County Inland Areas, San Bernardino County Mountains, San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire and Santa Ana Mountains and Foothills. * WHEN...From 10 PM PST this evening through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A storm system from the Pacific will bring occasional showers with a slight chance of thunderstorms, which could bring heavy rainfall. Rain rates could reach up to 1 inch per hour, especially Thursday and Thursday night. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
